Okay, feel sorry for you man. If you resign now, you will need to pay the pro-rated bonus back to Amazon. Also, they will charge you for the relocation expenses.Talk to manager/HRBP to expedite the pivot process. HRBP is generally happy to expedite the process. Post the pivot process (if you fail) here are your options:1. Leave Amazon with severance (Expect around 10 weeks of your salary given the current situation). They will also give you the full sign-on bonus and relocation amount. You would not be charged anything.2. Accept to enter PIP (roughly 30-60 days). If after PIP your manager is not satisfied, he will recommend termination. However, you can appeal. Amazon again gives you an option to take severance and not appeal. Severance is much lesser this time (expect 30-40% of previous severance)3. Appeal the decision. If you fail, you will be asked to leave. However, you still get a severance (expect 15% of severance in option 1)Some more data:Pivot process is around 45-60 daysYou get 5 business days to decide your options after pivot processPIP process is around 30-60 daysIf you decided to appeal, it takes around 5 business day for the decision to comeIn no background check, your pivot/pip details be shared. Amazon only shares start, end date and your designation as part of background check.
Should be vigilant, yes
Very useful info. I heard leaving amazon on pip will show up as being fired on background check. Is it not true?
